intro: Cliftonia ligustrina, commonly known as the Mexican privet, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like lilac and jasmine. The plant features opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and have a slightly rough texture. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale yellow and appear in clusters during the spring. The fruit is a small, dark blue to black drupe that contains a single seed.
